website_summaries.verdict: Building on the strengths of its predecessor, the Nokia 7.2 offers an attractive design and solid specs, but it faces stiff competition.

customer_reviews.title: Nokia - back were they belong....
customer_reviews.text: Having been a huge Nokia fan when they were the no 1 phones to have/desire. Since then I have gone with Apple but needed another phone for business. This seemed a great choice for very sensible money. If you don’t put a cover on it every time you hold it, some app or page opens due to the edge to edge screen. That was annoying rather than a fault.. It also comes with Android 1 which basically strips back all the pre installed apps some of us rarely use. If you’re after a sim free smartphone and being able to remember when Nokia made fantastic phones you will not be disappointed with this choice, just get a case for it!
customer_reviews.author: Golfnut26

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone, pity about the lack of system updates in a just-released phone.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is good but, despite being Android One and only just released, it is not getting timely system updates. Nokia claim the problem is with the mobile operator (Virgin). My wife has an old Nokia (> 1 year old) and it has a more up to date version of Android than my brand new phone. I bought this because I wanted a phone that was regularly updated (unlike most Android devices) and because Nokia boast about regularly updating their devices. Clearly that is an empty boast. So, if you want timely security updates, and perhaps if you are with Virgin, don't waste your money on this phone.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: What a mistake Please don't waste your money on this phone Fingerprint and face recognition hit and miss Battery drains quicker than the Nokia 6.1 I had before You can't customise ringtones Very dissatisfied Have already decided to go back to older Nokia that I trust You've let the standards drop on this one Nokia Thumbs down
customer_reviews.author: scotty

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Nokia 8 whose battery started dying by lunchtime. What an amazing upgrade this turned out to be. Okay, I'm not interested in playing video games so I don't know if it falls down in that area. But for slick browsing and for watching video this is superb. At £200 it's fabulous value. Or maybe I'm just out of touch. Mentioning touch, the only better feature on the 8 was its fingerprint sensor on the front rather than the back. A very minor point.
customer_reviews.author: tim freeborn

customer_reviews.title: Google Pixel like experience for a cheaper price!
customer_reviews.text: If, like me, you are an Android enthusiast then I highly recommend this product, very pleased with it. If you want to use stock android and receive 2 years of OS updates and 3 years of monthly security patches, then this is an excellent choice! Camera is great, UI is swift and responsive, fingerprint scanner is fast, battery lasts over a day and so much more!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Freedman

customer_reviews.title: Better then any iphone
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone for the price. After owning this for a while now its still awesome, I don't understand people who spend fortunes on top of the line phones this one beats them all and fab price too.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Allen

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: Nokia is making a comeback for sure. I had done a lot of research before I bought the 7.2. The fingerprint reader, which many people complained about, works like a charm. The reader instantly recognises my fingerprint. The pictures are of taken by the phone are clear and crisp. I would recommend buying the Nokia 7.2 or the updated versions if you're looking for a reasonably priced phone without the exorbitant price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: Really nice phone, previously had a Nokia 6 which was a very good phone. Then switched to a Galaxy A20e which was a big mistake, there is no comparison in quality. Nokia is far superior in quality and performance to Samsung The O2 network is very poor where I live and could not get any signal at all on the A20e. I'm now getting at least 2 bar signal in the Nokia 7.2. Love everything about this phone so far and definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Mark Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Solid, quality phone at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life exceptional so far, camera and fingerprint reader excellent. Consider it as 99% as good as a Pixel, but a fraction of the price. I will probably get a second one based on experience of this one.
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst phones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Sluggish, slow... and after 2 and a bit months the power button stopped working. This has been definitively one of the worst phones I've ever had and I strongly discourage anyone to buy it. It is simply not worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: good phone
customer_reviews.text: this phone has had a lot of comments everywhere, but I have to say I like it a lot, the battery life improves a little over time. I find the camera for my usage is great, some users comment about the lack of macro camera, we also have a Motorola with macro but I prefer the Nokia, although you have to fiddle with focus manually also it comes with
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Buggy!
customer_reviews.text: Promises so much, but is terribly let down by bugs that plague the system. High/lowlights include: 1. Proximity sensor that doesn't work properly when the phone is next to your face! 2. Face unlock clags up the system if you try and do it at the same type as a fingerprint unlock. 3. Camera is slow to process a photograph, dragging the system to a halt. 4. Random freezes and general poor performance. Terrible...steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: John Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Apps always crashing.
customer_reviews.text: I am strongly annoyed after buying this phone for £250 only 2 weeks ago it is malfunctioning on severel apps and constantly logging out of them. And am not happy and need help,but not there stupid live chat app wich is super slow.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mid price phone
customer_reviews.text: Nokia 7.2 is a brilliant phone. Got it as a Christmas present for my daughter an upgrade on her Nokia 6 and it is an upgrade. Great display, very good battery life...lasts a teenager all day so pretty good! Looks lovely, processor is excellent. Would recommend getting a case to keep it looking nice.
customer_reviews.author: Creeper55

customer_reviews.title: do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This phone is so very basic,it deleted my photos and music, the ar mode don't work, this phone is really poo
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get it elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Probably a decent phone If Amazon had been able to deliver it I could have found out
customer_reviews.author: Cabbie

customer_reviews.title: Sadly not as good as Huawei
customer_reviews.text: Fit for purpose but not astounding. Screen brightness temperamental. Not great battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Parkin

customer_reviews.title: Camera and fingerprint reader not working well
customer_reviews.text: i'm really disappointed. phone works really bad, camera not working well, you have to restart phone then it start work again and a lot of bad things. it really sad, but how can i do refund ???
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.text: Good till it stopped working. Sent for repair, and was seen back not repaired ,(water damage). Only had phone two months. Waiting to see why from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid that
customer_reviews.text: The worst phone I ever have, frozen screen from first day, after 4 month battery life was 5 hours, avoid please
customer_reviews.author: robybj

customer_reviews.title: Very pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: Very good phone for the money. Arrive 2 days earlier then expected. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Weiss Willy

customer_reviews.title: Great phone amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with the latest Nokia android one phones, this is the second I've bought in the past 2-3 years, and for the money you pay, it does everything a £500-£800 phone does for the most part, only thing it doesn't have is waterproofing. So far no problems, I bought this to replace my Nokia 7 plus, which I loved but it did have an issue with the charging port, which Nokia repaired twice for free, but the 7.2 is measuring up nicely and the camera is better which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Good middle/budget priced buy
customer_reviews.text: Hunted around for decent spec middle market/budget buy for my wife (min SNAP 660 processor grunt, 3500mAh battery, 4/64G RAM, 2280x1080 screen, Android 10, decent camera, 3.5 jack being the VIP key specs). I spent far longer watching reviews than I care to think and narrowed down the choice to Moto G8 plus, Nokia 8.1, Samsung A41/A51 all of which were more expensive (A51 perhaps nicest but a third more). We've owned Samsung's & Nokia's before and purchased this Nokia 7.2 on the price drop (model is being superseded). Loaded it with a stack of apps and a nano 64G A1 RAM card for the photos/Vids, seems to work fine so far and it seems nice to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine phone at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Maybe not a flagship phone but certainly a very good, well made, phone for the majority of users. The camera is good taking excellent photos and videos for a phone of this price. Night photo are quite impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Midrange rs are the flagships now
customer_reviews.text: Never knew I needed a wide angle lens till I got to use one. For a mid ranger more than what you expect. A tad slippery but slapped on a case and a popsocket glued to it and it's great. Screen is a major fingerprint magnet. EVERY SINGLE SMUDGE
customer_reviews.author: Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing camera and glitchy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. A glitchy phone. Randomly freezes. Camera not good at all. I wouldn't buy it again. You can get a better phone for the price. Really sad, I was looking forward to using Nokia again. My kid has had a 6.1 for over three years, cost less at the time than this one and even now is more trustworthy.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Very good phone for this price range
customer_reviews.text: I like the clean lines and features. Fingerprint reader works better than previous phone but sometimes takes a couple of attempts. A firm tap with the finger works better than pressing the finger against the reader. Not tried the camer very much lately. Heard reviews about rendering of reds not being very good but can't comment personally. I gather the gcam app helps compensate for this. Overall very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Whitesman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing camera which doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The camera unfortunately stopped working and it says that the camera keeps stopping .No matter what I try to do I cannot get it to work which is disappointing. One of the reasons I bought this phone was for the camera. Everything else works perfectly but I wouldn't recommend this phone to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MAURICE MC CORKELL

customer_reviews.title: Great with Android 10, poor with 9
customer_reviews.text: This phone changed completely with the Android 10 update. It was a bit of a buggy mess back in October/November 2019. Now it's really surprisingly good, and for £200 it's less of a worry to carry around. The camera is it's weakness but it's still pretty good. Probably the best phone I've had, including iPhones, mostly because Android is so much better than it used to be..
customer_reviews.author: sjk1000

customer_reviews.title: camera not
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this phone I have bought this the first month was okay , then the camera stop working then during call people could. not hear me every day I have got new issue with it then, the back off the phone it gets extremely hot sometimes I am very scared to keep the phone near me I feel like its about to explod, please , do not buy this phone it, you will for sure regret it .
customer_reviews.author: FARZAD KHALEDI

customer_reviews.title: Does it work in Africa?
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say,just need to know if it works in Africa. But its looks great
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: It was a great phone for the first 10 months and now it's absolutely awful. Crashes all the time. Can't do anything on it. It's taken a dozen attempts to write this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Nokia 7.2 6.3 Inch Android UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 4 GB RAM and 64 GB Storage (Dual Sim) – Charcoal
product_meta.description: Style Name:Nokia 7.2 CharcoalUnleash your creativity with Nokia 7.2. Capture incredible photos, watch all of your videos in HDR and go without charging for up to 2 days. Plus, it all runs smoothly on Android 9 Pie software – so just when you think it’s at its best, it just keeps getting better.
feature_bullets: Cameras - Triple camera setup including 48MP main camera and ZEISS Optics
Display - 6.3" Full HD+ screen with PureDisplay Real-time HDR conversion
Battery - Energy-efficient Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 processor, plus AI-assisted Adaptive Battery
Design - Multilayer coating for a smooth metallic finish and light-diffusing satin glass back
Google Assistant Button - Ask questions, see your schedule or even dim the lights with the Google Assistant Button

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
